Ibnul Huq

I am an aspiring Full Stack Developer looking to get my first role in the industry.

About me

After studying many online courses I have developed competence with MERN stack technologies, i.e. MongoDB, Express, React and Node.

My skills

Here is a list of skills I am familiar with. While my main competencies tend to fall within the MERN stack, I am happy to work with any of these technologies or learn something new.

Projects

Here is a list of all projects I have completed, with live demos and source code

Course Projects

Projects done as part of a course

Goalsetter

Full-stack MERN app with Redux, hosted on Heroku. Allows users to log in and save individual goals on MongoDB database. Authentication with JWT. Back-end REST API with Express, Front end with React and React Router

Live demoGithub repo

Bank app

A banking app made with pure JavaScript. This was done to learn array methods, DOM manipulation and the Internationalisation API. Login with: ih 1111 and jd 2222

Live demoGithub repo

To-do list

A To-do list app using Express and MongoDB back-end using GET and POST requests and EJS templates. New lists can be created by appending any string to the end of the URL.

Live demoGithub repo

Blog site

A blog site using Next.js front-end and strapi cms for back-end. Usage of a CMS allows live updating of the app without rebuilding or redeploying. New articles can be added through Strapi.

Live demoGithub repo

React notes

A React app to take notes, similar to Google Keep. Project was done to learn about functional components, props and useState hook.

Live demoGithub repo

Landing page

Landing page for an E-commerce site made with bootstrap. This was done to learn CSS frameworks as a faster alternative to pure CSS

Live demoGithub repo

Number game

Guess a hidden number between 1 and 20. Fewer guesses = more points. High score is saved. Background changes when correct number is guessed

Live demoGithub repo

Dice game

First person to reach 100 score wins. Roll dice as many times as possible, each roll contributes to score but if you roll a 1 you lose all points. Frequently save points to prevent this

Live demoGithub repo

Old Portfolio

A previous version of my portfolio, simpler version with fewer projects

Live demoGithub repo
